bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Francisco Dominguez [Roldan], January 6, 1942

div1.p: Hench asks if [Roldan] has a copy of an speech given by Carlos J. Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Francisco Dominguez [Roldan], January 6, 1942

opener.dateline:
January 6, 1942 Dr. Francisco Dominguez
Gutierrez
Marianao
Habana, Cuba

div1.p:
I appreciate very greatly your sending me your
article on the history of yellow fever which contained
the address which you gave on the occasion of the visit
of Dr. Matas. I am delighted indeed to have this.

Do you have any idea where I could find the
address which Dr. Finlay gave on that occasion? His son,
Dr. Charles E. Finlay, said that he did not have a copy but
thought that you had one. I wonder if you have been able
to find this. I am so anxious to show in my studies, the
tremendously important work which Dr. Finlay did.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
